element.name: H is for Ha-ha by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/1)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.long-description: Set in the environs of Powerscourt House. There is a fee to tour the house and the gardens - if you are visiting the shop, however, there is no fee. You know what to do! Just tell the person in the kiosk at the main gate that you are visiting the shop and proceed to the car park. Incidentally, a "ha-ha" is a sunken road - the purpose of which was to allow traffic to move around the estate without sullying the eyes of those in residence in the house.
element.encoded-hints: 3m from the gate, at ground level

ul.li:
2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by oldnavycarl
Im sure we were close but we had no joy. :-(

2010-05-25T11:54:00Z : Found it by rdraper
After looking for fifteen minutes at eye level, we re-read the hint at looked at ground level. And there it was. Great first find on our vacation. Drapers and Chandlers

2010-04-29T15:10:21Z : Didn't find it by edwincartwright
Dammit. New this one could be difficult and it proved to be so. I am very curious where it is. Gave up after 45 minutes searching with 3 people.

2010-04-25T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by MurphInerney
Had a quick look but the shop was closing so there were lots of muggles!!! I will return to try again

2008-09-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by bortsen
Very nice. This was my first cache ever. Thanks to kcdc for showing me this very interesting activity.
